uitutorial_msg_intro:
Hello? Is this thing on?

Alright, I see you're here. This tutorial will teach you the basics of the user interface in Zero-K. Pay attention â€“ we'll try not to let you do anything you shouldn't, but things will go faster if you follow instructions precisely.
uitutorial_objDesc_tut: Learn how to use the UI of Zero-K. Follow the provided instructions at each step.
uitutorial_persistent_tut1:
First off, we're going to explain how to use the camera. 

You can pan the camera with the \255\0\255\0\arrow keys\008 on your keyboard, or by \255\0\255\0\dragging with the middle mouse\008. Use the \255\0\255\0\scrollwheel\008 to zoom in and out.

Press \255\0\255\0\TAB\008 to toggle to overview mode.

Got that? Practice a bit if you like, then press Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut10:
The unit on the left is on a \255\255\255\0\Move\008 command. It proceeds straight to its movement destination, shooting at enemies on the way.

The unit on the right is on a \255\255\255\0\Fight\008 command. It stops to engage enemies it sees, waiting till the target is destroyed before moving on. (Constructors on a fight order will stop to do things like repair or construction assist jobs they come across.)

A \255\255\255\0\Patrol\008 command is essentially a looping Fight command.

Click Next when you're ready to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut11:
Now try it for yourself. Your commander has received a \255\255\255\0\Fire at Will\008 order again and will automatically engage targets.

Select your commander, press \255\0\255\0\F\008 (default) or click on the \255\255\255\0\Fight\008 button in the Orders tab of the menu. Then click on the position you want to fight to.

Destroy the new targets to the east to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut12:
Yeah baby!

We're almost ready to try something else first, but one more thing about move (and related) commands before we go.

TIP: Hold down \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 to queue multiple orders. Your unit(s) will execute them in sequence.
uitutorial_persistent_tut13:
You can perform a \255\255\255\0\line move\008 by clicking and dragging instead of just clicking when issuing the move command. (This also works with Fight.) Doing this causes your units to spread out along the length of a line. You can quickly draw useful formations such as encirclements in this manner.

Practice with the provided units, then click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut14:
Now let's try building a \255\0\255\255\Solar Collector\008 to make some \255\255\255\0\energy\008. Energy is needed to build things and run some abilities, like radar and cloaking.

Select your commander, look for the command menu and click on the \255\255\255\0\Econ\008 tab. Click on the Solar Collector and place it on the designated spot (or anywhere else, if you want).

(Note the color of the grid under the building you're placing. Red areas are obstructed by uneven terrain or another building. Yellow areas are occupied by a mobile unit or some feature that can be "reclaimed" to get it out of the way, such as a rock or tree.)
uitutorial_persistent_tut15:
Good job!

By the way, you can hold down \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 and drag a line of buildings to build them all in sequence. Shift + \255\0\255\0\Alt\008 places a box in the same way. Press \255\0\255\0\Ctrl\008 as well to make the box hollow.

While doing this you can press \255\0\255\0\Z\008 and \255\0\255\0\X\008 (default) as well to change the spacing.

Click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut16:
Energy alone isn't enough to build stuff. You need \255\255\255\0\metal\008 as well.

The primary source of metal is the \255\0\255\255\Metal Extractor\008. It can only be built on \255\255\255\0\metal spots\008. On most maps, these are represented as patches on the ground; you can also press \255\0\255\0\F4\008 to bring up the resource map: this lets you find them easily and see how much metal a mex placed on them will generate per second.

Select your commander, click on the \255\255\255\0\Econ\008 tab, click on the Metal Extractor. But here's where it gets different: just click close enough to the metal spot and it'll automatically snap to the right place. (If the resource map is visible, you can also \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the circle around the spot.)
uitutorial_persistent_tut17:
Good job!

Your current metal and energy are displayed as \255\255\255\0\bars on the top of the screen\008. You can store a limited amount of metal and energy; once storage is full, it's "use it or lose it." The numbers on the bar show useful information: current income, current expenditure and current stockpiles.

Click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut18:
Now let's make a \255\0\255\255\Cloaky Bot Factory\008 to build some units with.

In a skirmish or multiplayer game, you get a \255\255\255\0\"facplop"\008 that lets you build your first factory for free and instantly. This is indicated by the factory icon above your commander's head.

We've given you a facplop now. Select your commander, click on the \255\255\255\0\Factory\008 tab, and click on where you want to build the factory.

TIP: You can rotate buildings before placing them with \255\0\255\0\left bracket\008 and \255\0\255\0\right bracket\008 (by default).
uitutorial_persistent_tut19:
Good, good. Now we can try making some units.

Click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut2: Okay, there's a radar tower to the \255\255\255\0\west\008 of your starting position. See if you can find it.
uitutorial_persistent_tut20:
While mobile constructors (such as your commander) make static buildings, factory buildings make mobile units.

Select your factory and it will automatically switch to the \255\255\255\0\Units\008 tab. Click a unit to start building it. Right-click to remove the last such unit from the queue, or left-click on a specific unit in the buld queue on the bottom row to remove it.

Hold \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 while clicking to add/remove five units at a time, \255\0\255\0\Ctrl\008 for 20. Holding down \255\0\255\0\Alt\008 while clicking adds the unit to the front of the queue.

Build 5 Glaive bots to continue.

TIP: Give your commander a \255\255\255\0\Guard\008 order on the factory to "assist" it and make it build faster. Select the commander and \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the factory, or press \255\0\255\0\G\008 (or click on the button in the Order menu) and left-click.
uitutorial_persistent_tut21:
There we go.

TIP: \255\0\255\0\Space\008 + \255\0\255\0\click\008 on a unit to open a popup displaying a description of the unit and its stats. Try it out.

Click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut22:
Oh dear, that tank has taken damage. Get your commander over there and \255\255\255\0\repair\008 it.

Press \255\0\255\0\R\008 (default) or click on the \255\255\255\0\Repair\008 button in the Orders tab, then click on the unit you want to repair. Or just right-click on the target.

Repair costs energy. It is normally twice as fast as building the same unit, but is slowed down if the unit has been damaged recently.

(If a unit is left alone long enough it will also slowly self-repair. But do you really have the time for that?)
uitutorial_persistent_tut23:
Good job fixing that tank!

Now there's just one last thing to do.
uitutorial_persistent_tut24:
By now you've probably noticed the \255\255\255\0\fog of war\008. Units have a limited sight range; anything not close enough to one or more of your units is hidden from view. This is marked by the grey area in the map.

\255\255\255\0\Radar\008 can detect enemies hiding in the darkness (up to a certain range), although you won't be able to identify unit types. Enemies revealed by radar are marked as radar dots.

To actually see what's going on somewhere, you'll need to scout it. Small, fast units are ideal for scouting.

There is an enemy tank hiding somewhere to the \255\255\255\0\northwest\008. Destroy it to win the game.
uitutorial_persistent_tut25:
Excellent work! That concludes the tutorial.

Feel free to practice the controls some more, or leave at any time.
uitutorial_persistent_tut3:
Good, you found the radar tower. Now let's try something else.

Click Next to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut4:
You can select a unit by \255\255\255\0\clicking\008 on it. 

Select multiple units by left-click \255\255\255\0\dragging a box\008 around them, or holding down \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 or \255\0\255\0\Ctrl\008 and clicking on each one. You can also Ctrl + click an already selected unit to deselect it.

Your commander can be quickly selected by pressing \255\0\255\0\Ctrl\008 + \255\0\255\0\C\008 or clicking the commander icon in the selection bar.

Now select... not your commander, but the Lotus light laser tower nearby to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut5:
Good work, you've selected the tower as ordered.

You can practice selecting units a bit more; click Next when you're done.
uitutorial_persistent_tut6:
Now let's move about a bit.

To move a unit, select it, press \255\0\255\0\M\008 or click on the \255\255\255\0\Move\008 button in the Orders tab of the menu. Then click on the destination.

... But nobody actually does this. Just \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the ground where you want to move.

Select your command unit and move it to the marked point up \255\255\255\0\north\008 by the wind generator to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut7:
Now you know how to get around.

Click Next when you're done.
uitutorial_persistent_tut8:
Let's shoot something!

Normally your units will automatically fire on anything in range. For now, we've given a \255\255\255\0\Hold Fire\008 order to your command unit, so you'll have to manually attack the target.

Select your commander, press \255\0\255\0\A\008 or click on the \255\255\255\0\Attack\008 button in the Orders tab of the menu. Or just \255\0\255\0\right click\008 the target.

Destroy the construction vehicle to the east to continue.
uitutorial_persistent_tut9:
Boom.

Now let's take a look at the Fight command.
